title: EUROMACS-RHF Score
description: Determines risk of right ventricular heart failure in patients after left ventricular assist device (LVAD) implantation.

parameters.name: ra_pcwp_ratio_elevated
parameters.description: Right atrial pressure to pulmonary capillary wedge pressure ratio >0.54

parameters.name: intermacs_class_low
parameters.description: INTERMACS Class 1-3 (critical cardiogenic shock to stable but inotrope dependent)

parameters.name: severe_rv_dysfunction
parameters.description: Severe right ventricular dysfunction by echocardiogram

result.name: rhf_risk_assessment
result.description: Right heart failure risk assessment with score and risk stratification

ranges.interpretation: Low risk of right heart failure (11% incidence). Standard perioperative monitoring and management. Consider routine hemodynamic assessment post-LVAD implantation.
Intermediate risk of right heart failure. Enhanced monitoring recommended. Consider closer hemodynamic surveillance and optimization of right ventricular support.

High risk of right heart failure (43.1% incidence). Requires intensive monitoring and proactive management. Consider biventricular assist device or total heart support. Optimize hemodynamics and consider advanced RV support strategies.

references: Soliman OII, Akin S, Muslem R, Boersma E, Manintveld OC, Krabatsch T, et al. Derivation and Validation of a Novel Right-Sided Heart Failure Model After Implantation of Continuous Flow Left Ventricular Assist Devices: The EUROMACS (European Registry for Patients with Mechanical Circulatory Support) Right-Sided Heart Failure Risk Score. Circulation. 2018 Mar 6;137(9):891-906. doi: 10.1161/CIRCULATIONAHA.117.030543.

Bellavia D, Iacovoni A, Scardulla C, Moja L, Pilato M, Kushwaha SS, et al. Prediction of right heart failure after left ventricular assist device implantation. Eur Heart J Acute Cardiovasc Care. 2017 Dec;6(8):668-676. doi: 10.1177/2048872615612455.

Kormos RL, Cowger J, Pagani FD, Teuteberg JJ, Goldstein DJ, Jacobs JP, et al. The Society of Thoracic Surgeons Intermacs database annual report: evolving indications, outcomes, and scientific partnerships. J Heart Lung Transplant. 2019 Feb;38(2):114-126. doi: 10.1016/j.healun.2018.11.013.
formula: EUROMACS-RHF Score = (RA/PCWP >0.54 × 2) + (Hemoglobin ≤10 g/dL × 1) + (Multiple IV inotropes × 2.5) + (INTERMACS Class 1-3 × 2) + (Severe RV dysfunction × 2)
notes: Derived from 2,988 adult patients undergoing continuous-flow LVAD implantation
Predicts early (<30 days) severe postoperative right heart failure
RHF defined as: short/long-term right-sided circulatory support, continuous inotropic support ≥14 days, or nitric oxide ventilation ≥48 hours
Multiple inotropes has greatest weight in predicting post-LVAD RHF
C-index: 0.70 in derivation cohort, 0.67 in validation cohort
External validation studies show variable performance
Use for preoperative assessment and risk stratification
High-risk patients may benefit from biventricular assist device consideration
Score should be combined with clinical judgment and other assessment tools
Associated with increased ICU stay and reduced 1-year and 2-year survival
May guide perioperative monitoring intensity and intervention strategies
